introduction: This video discusses the basics of agile project management, its principles, implementation steps, and various frameworks involved in the process. It also highlights some companies that have adopted agile methodology.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Agile Project Management
content: Agile project management is a flexible approach to building projects.
The project is broken down into sprints, with the focus on delivering sections of a project or mini-projects.
The process of project management in agile is agile-based, with no central control of the project manager.
High product quality is achieved through testing at short intervals, with sprints and each sprint having its own version.

sections.title: Section 2: Principles of Agile Project Management
content: There are 10 principles for successful agile project management.
Customer satisfaction is a primary concern by delivering the project fast and with least effort.
There must be a feeling of trust and support towards the team to complete the projects objectives.
Facetoface conversations with the development team help in problem-solving and easy knowledge sharing.

sections.title: Section 3: Implementation Steps in Agile Project Management
content: Release planning is the first step in agile project management.
Sprint planning involves the stakeholders to show them the finished product.
Sprint review is the second meeting for having a sprint retrospective.
Sprint retrospective takes place after the sprint review and before the next sprint planning.

sections.title: Section 4: Agile Project Management Frameworks
content: Scrum is a simple framework that helps team work together and learn through their experiences.
The hybrid framework is a combination of agile methodology and non-agile methodology.
The lean framework works on the principle of providing maximum customer value and creating zero waste.
The Kanban framework is a visual system for managing workflow and improving processes.

sections.title: Section 5: Companies Using Agile Project Management
content: Around 22 percent of organizations worldwide have all their teams working on the principle of agile project management.
Some prominent companies using agile methodology include IBM, Cisco, AT&T, Microsoft, Philips, and Samsung.
